Assistant Chief Engineer Job at Hilton Worldwide




        
    

        
        Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Chief Engineer
     

            
    



Job ID: HOT0C9FC
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	An Assistant Chief Engineer is responsible for all maintenance issues within the hotel to deliver an excellent Guest and Member experience while performing daily checks, repairing equipment, and coordinating renovation projects.


What will I be doing?


	As an Assistant Chief Engineer, you will be responsible for all maintenance issues within the hotel, daily, maintenance checks, and repairing mechanical equipment to deliver an excellent Guest and Member experience.
	An Assistant Chief Engineer will also be required to coordinate renovation projects and develop emergency programs.


Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:


	Responsible for maintenance issues within the hotel
	Perform daily checks around the hotel
	Conduct lift emergency release procedures as required
	Diagnose, maintain, and repair mechanical equipment within the hotel
	Ensure good relationships are built with internal and external customers
	Maintenance of all hotel fixtures and fittings to ensure they are in safe condition and take action when any unsafe situations arise
	Develop, implement, and direct all emergency programs
	Develop, implement and manage energy conservation programs for the property to minimize expenses
	Coordinate renovation bidding, define the cost and scope of the project, and oversee the general contractor and subcontractors to ensure quality work is performed cost effectively
	Perform special projects and other responsibilities as assigned
	Responsible for the health and safety of the hotel
	Ensure monthly safety inspections take place and employees are trained accordingly


What are we looking for?
An Assistant Chief Engineer serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow:


	Advanced knowledge of building management/engineering
	Positive attitude
	Good communication skills
	Committed to delivering a high level of customer service
	Excellent grooming standards
	Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations
	Ability to work under pressure
	Ability to work on their own
	Previous experience in a management role


It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:


	First Aid
	Vocational training in engineering or similar field

	As a Direct Sales Agent, you will play a critical role in driving the company&rsquo;s sales growth by directly engaging with customers, understanding their needs, and offering solutions that meet their requirements.

	The position sits within the Marketing and Sales department, emphasizing its essential contribution to business expansion and customer acquisition.

	Attend sales meetings, training sessions, and industry events to expand knowledge and stay abreast of market trends.
	Collaborate with team members and other departments to ensure the delivery of excellent customer service and foster a supportive sales environment.

	A High School Diploma or equivalent is required; a Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field is a plus.
	Previous sales experience is not necessary but beneficial; an enthusiastic willingness to learn is essential.

Direct Sales Agent Job at Farifaiz Investment Limited




        
    

        
        Farifaiz Investment Limited is a leading FMCG, Logistics and Energies business company with different lines of businesses. The company has two other subsidiaries; The Kursi Ltd ( A Real Estate ) and D-Arsh Capital LTD( A financial Lending and Credit Services )

Also, the company has a direct partnerships or distributionship with global leading beverages companies, such as, Nigerian Bottling Company( Coca-cola's Company) and 7up Bottling Company Ltd( Pepsi Company) etcs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Direct Sales Agent
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	As a Direct Sales Agent, you will play a critical role in driving the company’s sales growth by directly engaging with customers, understanding their needs, and offering solutions that meet their requirements.
	You will serve as a key representative of the company, showcasing our brand and products to potential customers.
	The position sits within the Marketing and Sales department, emphasizing its essential contribution to business expansion and customer acquisition.
	As an entry-level role, the position offers a dynamic environment to build foundational sales skills and advance in your career.
	The company provides comprehensive training, ensuring you acquire the necessary skills to succeed, while also offering continuous support and development opportunities.
	Through your efforts, you will contribute to increasing the company’s market share and enhancing customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and approach potential customers through various channels, including face-to-face presentations, telephone calls, and online interactions.
	Present and promote company products or services to existing and potential clients, addressing questions and concerns to facilitate a positive sales experience.
	Achieve or exceed assigned sales targets, tracking sales activities, and maintaining up-to-date progress reports.
	Attend sales meetings, training sessions, and industry events to expand knowledge and stay abreast of market trends.
	Collaborate with team members and other departments to ensure the delivery of excellent customer service and foster a supportive sales environment.


Required Qualifications


	A High School Diploma or equivalent is required; a Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field is a plus.
	Previous sales experience is not necessary but beneficial; an enthusiastic willingness to learn is essential.


Desired Skills:


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Self-motivation with an ability to handle rejection positively and persistently.
	Basic computer proficiency, particularly in Microsoft Office suite.


Additional Information:


	The company offers attractive commission-based incentives in addition to a base salary for achieving and exceeding sales targets.
	Opportunities for career advancement and professional growth within the company are available for high-performing individuals.

        Expected to open 2025, Hyatt Regency Lagos Ikeja is ideally located in the serene GRA and just moments away from Murtala Muhammed International Airport. Hyatt Regency Lagos Ikeja is a premier hotel in Lagos, Nigeria, offering the perfect blend of convenience and elegance where our guests feel comfortable, connected, and encouraged to be their best selves because they are welcome and relaxed in our care.

Hyatt Regency hotels and resorts are founded on openness - our colleagues consistently serve with open minds and open hearts to deliver unforgettable celebrations, effortless relaxation and notable culinary experiences alongside expert meetings and technology-enabled collaboration.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: General Manager

Req ID: LAG000021
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Summary


	This is an opportunity to step into a defining leadership role in Hyatt and shape the future of the pre-opening hotel, Hyatt Regency Lagos, Ikeja.
	As General Manager, you will inspire exceptional teams through purposeful leadership, and grow the hotel’s culture, performance and long-term success.
	You will be leading with intention, emotional intelligence and cultural sensitivity - and creating an environment where people feel valued, empowered and proud to belong.
	If you are ready to grow your career, inspire through your leadership and care for what truly matters, we invite you to apply and begin your next chapter with Hyatt.


Responsibities
What you’ll do:


	Oversee, manage and support the successful opening of the hotel. 
	Oversee the overall strategy, performance and profitability of the property: ensuring that it is operating with excellence.
	Align with Hyatt’s core values to maximize revenue and profit opportunities and ensure the efficient and effective management of the property asset.
	With integrity and in alignment with our Leadership Expectations, lead a diverse team to build the trust of others in all interactions and cultivate a positive guest and colleague experience.
	Continuously find ways to improve all areas of the property and remain flexible in rapidly changing environments.
	Bring Hyatt’s values to life for the benefit of colleagues, guests, customers and owners by demonstrating excellence in all aspects of the guest experience and overall performance of the hotel.


Qualifications


	Proven experience as a General Manager or Senior Leadership commitee member aspiring to become a General Manager
	Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain positive relationships with all stakeholders: Ownership; Corporate; hotel’s management, colleagues, clients and vendors.
	Exceptional relationship-building skills across owners, partners, guests, and teams
	Commercial acumen with a track record of delivering financial, guest, and colleague results
	History of collaboration in building and executing overarching hotel strategies on a daily, weekly, monthly and annual basis.
	Creative mind and entrepreneurial spirit. Embraces experimentation and Hyatt Ways of Working
	A Food & Beverage background will be an advantage
	Arabic speaking will be an advantage


Benefits
Care Connects us at Hyatt - we open doors, we welcome you and we care and offer a great range of benefits, including:


	Long term career growth opportunities
	A motivated and connected team
	12 complimentary nights (per year) in other Hyatt properties around the world as well as colleague rates and discounts
